newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Shell to inaugurate Venezuela lubricants plant.
newsitem.headline: Shell to inaugurate Venezuela lubricants plant.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell unit Shell de Venezuela SA will inaugurate Saturday a lubricants plant in the industrial city Valencia in central western Venezuela.

The plant, one of 80 Shell operates worldwide, has a production capacity of 30,000 tonnes per year in a wide range of motor oils and took nine months to build, Venezuela's presidential palace said in a release.

Venezuela began to allow competition in its lubricants sector last year as part of a gradual opening up of the state-owned oil industry. President Rafael Caldera and Carabobo state Governor Henrique Salas will join Shell de Venezuela President Bernard Wheelahan at the opening ceremony.
